intro: Cacalia bracteata, commonly known as the bracted cacalia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pale blue petals. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Cacalia bracteata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
